p: The multiple sequence alignment of 2,417 H5N1-HA sequences (average length: 1710.28 ± 34.37 nt, minimum length: 1602 nt, maximum length: 1809 nt), with minimum length of 1600 nt (>90% open frame read length), spanning a three year period corresponding to the epidemiological analysis interval, and obtained from GISAID EpiFlu database [ 24] resulted in an alignment spanning 1841 nucleotides in 5 refinement iterations out of the maximum configured 16 iterations. The phylogram generated from the alignment using neighbor joining and the GTR+I+Γ model in PAUP* was categorized into 130 clades using the criteria proposed by WHO/OIE/FAO [ 23] which requires that percentage pairwise nucleotide distances between and within clades are > 1.5% and < 1.5% respectively. An overview of the resulting phylogram is shown in Figure 5. The resulting phylogram was manually cross-verified to be consistent with the WHO/OIE/FAO reference taxonomy phylogenetic tree [ 23].
